{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32848].
  {panel}

Came across the following ticket that was discussing about this matter:
* [Attachments not recoreded in Change History|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-16785]

It might be quite confusing as the *initial* creation of a ticket that has an attachment included in it is not recorded in the *History* tab. However, the next attachment included in the ticket is recorded. The only way to check on this is through the *Manage Attachments* option. Is this an intended behavior? The following screenshot(s) explain:

* _Creating a new issue with the attachment {{jira.jpg}} attached to the issue_
!create_issue_1.JPG!

!create_issue_2.JPG!

* _Checking the *Activity* tab and *History* tab, nothing is recorded_
!activity_tab.JPG!

!history_tab.JPG!

* _Checking through *Manage Attachments*, you are able to see the details of the attachment_
!manage_attachment.JPG!

* _After including another attachment {{greenhopper.png}} to the ticket, then you can see the changes_
!activity_tab_2.JPG!

!history_tab_2.JPG!
fields.summary: Initial Attachment history to be recorded either in History / Activity tab
Comments should always be visible to their authors

fields.description:
This previously used to work in JIRA 4.1.1 it has been tested on the latest version of JIRA 5.2.x and it breaks JIRA startup.

Reproduction steps, in JIRA 5.2.x
* Open the JIRA_INSTALL/bin/setenv.sh file
* Add the line: 
{quote}
JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS="-Dhttp.nonProxyHost=*.test.com|localhost"
{quote}
* Start JIRA, and phail

If the same is done on JIRA 4.1.x the pipe in the variable will not break the script.
fields.summary: Putting a pipe in a variable in setenv.sh breaks the start up scripts
Command-clicking image links should always open in a new tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32842].
  {panel}

h3. The problem:
Currently the table *jiraissue* has no restriction to insertion of null values into the column *pkey*. This situation can lead to problems as the one described in this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+throws+NullPointerException+while+re-indexing+due+to+pkey+with+null+value].

See desc table:
{code}
mysql> desc jiraissue;
+----------------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
| Field                | Type          | Null | Key | Default | Extra |
+----------------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
| ID                   | decimal(18,0) | NO   | PRI | NULL    |       |
| pkey                 | varchar(255)  | YES  | UNI | NULL    |       |
| PROJECT              | decimal(18,0) | YES  | MUL | NULL    |       |
| REPORTER             | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| ASSIGNEE             | varchar(255)  | YES  | MUL | NULL    |       |
| issuetype            | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| SUMMARY              | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| DESCRIPTION          | longtext      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| ENVIRONMENT          | longtext      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| PRIORITY             | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| RESOLUTION           | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| issuestatus          | varchar(255)  | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| CREATED              | datetime      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| UPDATED              | datetime      | YES  | MUL | NULL    |       |
| DUEDATE              | datetime      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| RESOLUTIONDATE       | datetime      | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| VOTES                | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| WATCHES              | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| TIMEESTIMATE         | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| TIMESPENT            | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| WORKFLOW_ID          | decimal(18,0) | YES  | MUL | NULL    |       |
| SECURITY             | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| FIXFOR               | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
| COMPONENT            | decimal(18,0) | YES  |     | NULL    |       |
+----------------------+---------------+------+-----+---------+-------+
25 rows in set (0.46 sec)
{code}

h3. Proposed fix:

The create table script could include the *NOT NULL* parameter:
{code:sql}
CREATE TABLE jiraissue (
ID decimal(18,0) NOT NULL,
pkey varchar(255) NOT NULL,
...
{code}
fields.summary: The table jiraissue should not permit null value for pkey column
Update 'Database limitations on number of projects' page to include details on Oracle limitation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32836].
  {panel}

Reproduction sequence:
1. Pick up an issue that is visible to user 1 and not visible to user 2. Let's say it has ID 10111.
2. User 1 creates saved filter {{issue = 10111}} and shares with user 2.
3. User 2 opens the saved filter.

Obsreved: no errors, no result.
Expected: error message that issue does not exist.

The expectation is set by the case when issue key is used instead of issue ID.

Speculation:
As with JRA-32772, this is because if query string equals saved filter string, it is not validated ({{DefaultIssueTableService.getIssueTable()}}). Here, after sanitization the query remains the same, and is not validated.
fields.summary: Lack of query revalidation for saved filters in Issue Navigator leads to unexplained empty query result

fields.description:
When adding an attachment which filename contains non ASCII characters via REST API, the filename will not be properly stored and displayed in JIRA. 

For an example, when adding an attachment with the filename {{ÉíüÄ.txt}}, then the filename in the issue will be rendered as "����.txt". Please see the following screenshot:
!REST.png!

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
- Create a test file, and name the file using any non-ASCII characters
- Attach the file to a JIRA issue via REST. Sample command will be:
{code}
curl -D- -u admin:admin -X POST -H "X-Atlassian-TOken: nocheck" -Q "OPTS UTF8 ON" -F "file=@ÉíüÄ.txt" http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/issue/NP-1/attachments
{code}
- After adding the attachment, go back to the related issue and check the attached file name
fields.summary: Adding attachment with non ASCII characters using REST

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32808].
  {panel}

To make the information at https://jira.example.com/secure/admin/monitor_database.jspa more useful, please would you add

- the timezone of the JIRA server for the values on the x-axis. This helps correlate spikes in load with the work day
- the database hostname and database name (and maybe port), since that's what a DB admin will likely want to know. I guess the JDBC string would work fine for this.
- some throughput data. The number of reads and writes is a guide, but are they big reads or little reads?
fields.summary: More context on the Database Monitoring page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to edit project roles

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 24 project roles.
# Create 451 projects. 
# Open page "Administration >> Users >> Project roles (for any user)" then edit the project role. 
# Save the changes.

h3. Expected Results
Saving the changes without any error.

h3. Actual Results
A 500 error page will be displayed.
You may find either of the exceptions below in the logs:
{noformat}
2013-04-25 18:34:15,707 http-bio-6523-exec-14 ERROR      [500ErrorPage.jsp] Exception caught in 500 page null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.EditUserProjectRoles.updateRoleActorsForProjectRole(EditUserProjectRoles.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.EditUserProjectRoles.doExecute(EditUserProjectRoles.java:54)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:82)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:221)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:150)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:153)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:722)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:305)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:210)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.steps.ChainedFilterStepRunner.doFilter(ChainedFilterStepRunner.java:78)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:243)
	(...)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)
{noformat} 

{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException: parameter should not be null!
com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException: parameter should not be null!
    	at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.notNull(Assertions.java:29)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.actor.UserRoleActorFactory.createRoleActor(UserRoleActorFactory.java:71)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.security.roles.PluginDelegatingRoleActorFactory.createRoleActor(PluginDelegatingRoleActorFactory.java:38)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.projectroles.DefaultProjectRoleService.createRoleActors(DefaultProjectRoleService.java:962)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.projectroles.DefaultProjectRoleService.updateActorsToProjectRole(DefaultProjectRoleService.java:891)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.projectroles.DefaultProjectRoleService.addActorsToProjectRole(DefaultProjectRoleService.java:1207)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.EditUserProjectRoles.updateRoleActorsForProjectRole(EditUserProjectRoles.java:170)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.EditUserProjectRoles.doExecute(EditUserProjectRoles.java:52)
    	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
    	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:87)
    	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
    	(...)
    	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:722)
{noformat} 

h3.Workaround
# Backup the {{server.xml}} file.
# Edit the {{server.xml}} file and add the parameter below in the *Connector* used for JIRA:
{code}
maxParameterCount="-1"
{code}
Example:
{code:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
<Connector acceptCount="100" connectionTimeout="20000" disableUploadTimeout="true" enableLookups="false" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" port="8080" protocol="HTTP/1.1" redirectPort="8443" useBodyEncodingForURI="true" maxParameterCount="-1"/>
{code}
# Restart JIRA.

Source: https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/config/http.html#Common_Attributes
fields.summary: JIRA throws a 500 Error when updating the user project role

fields.description:
There is a spelling mistake of *esablish* which suppose to be *establish* in 
bq. Unable to esablish a connection with the database.

Also, when we are at it, is it possible to further improve the error thrown to sent more clearer message?

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Start JIRA that is connected to external database (eg. MySQL)
# Go to Issue Navigator
# Stop MySQL service
# Click on one of the issue in the Issue Navigator

h4. Error thrown:

!esablish.PNG|thumbnail!

{noformat}
Cause:
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Unable to esablish a connection with the database. fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32788].
  {panel}

The @mentions feature is handy for bringing arbitrary folks into a conversation about an issue.  If folks mentioned in comments do not become watchers of an issue, however, they can miss subsequent comments.  This behavior could become a real problem if multiple people are mentioned in a comment.

Here's the scenario:
* Enter a comment in JIRA, @mentioning multiple individuals.
* One of the mentioned individuals gets the email and visits JIRA to enter a reply.
* Unless that individual mentions the same set of folks as in the original comment, none of the other individuals mentioned in the original comment will see the reply.  They will be out of the loop.

With the current mechanism, anyone mentioned in a comment needs to be sure they read all comments that were posted after the comment in which they were mentioned, to see if they've missed some replies from other participants.  This could be confusing for users and encourage them to keep using email to communicate rather than JIRA. :(

I can see the rationale for postponing the watch event until they visit the issue.  This behavior implements a sort of 'opt-in' system.  Unfortunately, it could result in users missing out on parts of a conversation.
fields.summary: Add @mentions to watcher list on comment entry

h3. Problem

A lot of users need either to remove the default "Name" and "Email" from the Issue collector or set them as required. Neither of these options are currently available to be configured without customization.

h3. What we want

We want to have the possibility of modifying these fields just like any other else, so we can set them as required or remove them in case it's necessary.

h3. Workaround

The wokaround is stated in the following answer and the following KB's:

- [Issue Collector: Can 'Name' and 'Email' be made required fields?|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/94823/issue-collector-can-name-and-email-be-made-required-fields]
- [How to remove "Name" and "Email" from the Issue Collector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=343834801]
- [How to set "Name" and "Email" as required fields in the Issue Collector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=343834804]

There is no workaround for JIRA OnDemand.
fields.summary: Modify "name" and "email" fields from the Issue collector

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32772].
  {panel}

Reproduction sequence:

# Create and save filter H = {{priority = Critical}}.
# Create and save filter F = {{filter = H and not summary ~ clone}}.
# Create and save filter G = {{filter = F and assignee is empty}}.
# Click filter H in the "Favourite Filters" section in the Issue Navigator.
# Click filter G in the same section.

Observe: error message 
{panel}Field 'filter' with value 'F' matches filter 'F' and causes a cyclical reference, this query can not be executed and should be edited.{panel}

Expected: no error message.

Speculation:

When {{SavedFilterClauseValidator}} checks whether any nested saved filters reference the current saved filter, it uses {{sessionSearchRequestManager.getCurrentObject()}}, which doesn't get updated on step 5 and returns {{H}}. Since {{G(F(H()))}} references {{H}},  the wrong error message is displayed.

Note that this problem manifests only if saved filters are revalidated. Revalidation does not happen if the query in the Issue Navigator {{equals()}} the query of the saved filter ({{DefaultIssueTableService.getIssueTable()}}). Due to the strange way {{Query.equals()}} is implemented (comparing query strings), it happens always if the saved filter features lowercase {{and}} (the saved version has uppercase {{AND}}, and the version in the Issue Navigator has lowercase {{and}}) and does not happen if the filter's query string coincides with the generated string.

Reproduced on JIRA 5.2.6 (Standalone) and OnDemand ([https://bukkit.atlassian.net]).
fields.summary: SessionSearchRequestManager.getCurrentObject() is not updated when the user clicks another saved filter in the Issue Navigator

4. Add a LDAP directory that has a higher priority than internal directory.
5. create user "test.user" with "PASS2" in LDAP system.
6. add him to some LDAP groups (different to "testgroup").

8. Login works using the LDAP user, since internal dir has a lower prio.
9. Go to user administration and search for "test.user".
10. search result shows correct information. Groups are from LDAP.
11. search now for "testgroup" and "test.user".
12. user "test.user" will be shown now as a user from internal directory with groups listed from LDAP. The search group "testgroup" is not shown.

  {panel}

If a ticket is moved, there is a link that automatically redirects from the original ticket key to the new one.  If JIRA's ticket key counter is reset, it does not check to see if this link already exists, before adding the ticket key.

Tested on JIRA 5.2.11

Steps:
* Create issue in a project (example: TST-1)
* Move TST-1 to another project
** Let's say the new key is MOV-2
** access TST-1 will redirect to MOV-2
* Reset JIRA's counter for the TST project
** aka the pcounter in database
* Create new issue under project TST
* JIRA assigns it to TST-1
* The original link between TST-1 and MOV-2 is broken

Expected behaviour is a check to see if the ticket number is reserved for a link.  For example, if the issue was not moved, you would get an error like so:
{code}
2013-04-16 10:10:10,592 http-8443-Processor241 ERROR username 36372x847927x3 6a9lyn https://jira-server-name/secure/CreateSubTaskIssueDetails.jspa [atlassian.jira.project.DefaultProjectManager] Existing issue found for key TST-1. Incrementing key.
{code}
fields.summary: Issue keys can overwrite keys of moved tickets, overwriting the moved link

fields.description:
I have set up the JIRA space on my server, according to your suggestion on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Local+Jira+Documentation.

I did also update the help-paths.properties file per your instructions on this page.

Resulting this setup, the "What's New" feature is broken, because it now forms an URL like http:<myserver>/<docspace>/whatsnew/iframe .
This is not a valid Confluence URL.
"https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/whatsnew/iframe" appears to be a redirection on the atlassian doc server which redirects to www.atlassian.com/en/software/jira/whats-new-iframe/<version>
This mechanism doesn't exist on your customer's confluence instance, therefore the URL is broken.

According to investigation done by Atlassian support, the velocity template "whats-new.vm" should be modified, so it does not build an URL to the local documentation server but always to the Atlassian server. (see CSP-100538)
fields.summary: Local Help breaks "Whats New" feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32751].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In certain circumstances some fields in the Issue Navigator are greyed out when they don't need to be.

h3. Environment

* Mac OS X 10.7.5.
* PostgreSQL 9.1.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add Project A & Project B.
# Add the same version names to both projects.
# In the Project dropdown, select 2 Projects (Project A and Project B)
# In the "More Criteria" field, search for "Fix Version"

h3. Expected Results

The fix versions that are identical are selectable.

h3. Actual Results

Although both Projects are sharing same version numbers, the Fix Version is greyed out and cannot be added.

h3. Notes

# In the filters, select one and only one project from the "Project" dropdown (example: Project A)
# In the "More Criteria", select Fix Version (--> This works)
# Now, from the Fix Version dropdown, select all the versions that you need (5.1, 5.2,...)
# Then only, from the "Project" dropdown, add the 2nd Project (example: Project B)
# The correct issues are returned
# If you go to "Switch to advanced" the JQL query is 
{code}project in ("Project A", "Project B") AND fixVersion in ("5.1", "5.2"){code}

This leads to all sorts of fun as well, try:

# Select Project A.
# Select Fix Version.
# Unselect Project.
# Project A & Project B are returned & Fix Version is greyed.
# Remove fix version as an option.
# Select Project A.
# Try to add Fix Version. It's greyed out - to fix you need to refresh the page.
fields.summary: Fix version is greyed out in the 5.2 Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32750].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using the *Default Reporter* in mail, it will append the from address to the description of the issue as per the [Creating Issues and Comments from Email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email] docs:

{quote}
* When an issue is created and this option is specified, the email message's From: field address is appended in a brief message at the end of the issue's Description field, so that the sender can be identified.
{quote}

For example:

{quote}
Contents
[Created via e-mail received from: "Captain Planet" <captain.planet@example.com>]
{quote}

h3. Environment

* Gmail SMTP/IMAP
* Google Web Client
* PostgreSQL 9.1
* Mac OS X 10.7.5
*Added on 9th July 2014:
* JIRA OnDemand
* Mac Mail Client
* JIRA 6.1.7 and 6.2.7 tested also affected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add a new user, e.g.: {{defaultreporter}}.
# Create a mail handler with the following:
{quote}
Strip Quotes: false
Default Reporter: Defaultreporter
Catch Email Address: email@example.com
Bulk: delete
Forward Email: email@example.com
Create Users: false
Notify Users: true
CC Assignee: false
CC Watchers: true
{quote}
# Send an email to that mailbox.

h3. Expected Results

It creates the email and appends the "Created via e-mail received from" section.

h3. Actual Results

It does not append those details.

h3. Notes
Do try the following if you found the reporter to be having mixed case. It should only affect the earlier version.
{quote}
To workaround this, change the reporter to lower-case to match the user, e.g.: {{defaultreporter}}.
{quote}

But if this does not work for you, comment on this ticket on the JIRA version being used.

h4. Update by [~rgee] 9th July 2014:
There are some reported cases that it also affects the user that does not contain mixed case username. Tested able to replicate on my environment. Additional information being added onto this ticket.
fields.summary: Mail handler doesn't append the FROM address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32745].
  {panel}

It would be extremely useful if the Jira Create Issue dialog searched not only on Project Name, but also on Project Key when the user is typing to get a match on the Project. It can be extremely frustrating, time-wasting, and dangerous when a Project Name (just a Description field, right?) is changed and email notification of this event is not sent by the person making the change. Why? Because the user will probably not find the Project being looked for since it has been renamed.

Example:

Project Name: Foobar
Project Key: FOOB

Project Foobar is renamed by the Project Lead to "Ribitz" for reasons only understood by the Project Lead.

Another user goes to create an issue in Foobar, starts typing "foob" and nothing pops out! The user then looks around a little and doesn't see Foobar. What's going on? Sound the alarm! Who deleted the Foobar Jira Project?

If the Project matching was also done on the Project Key, the user would have found Ribitz right away, been confused for a second, and then realized what had happened. Or at least the user would have been lead in the right direction.
fields.summary: Create Issue should also search on Project Key, not just Project Name

fields.description:
When you create an user, an entry gets created in the table {{EXTERNAL_ENTITIES}} in the database. The entitytype is {{com.atlassian.jira.user.OfbizExternalEntityStore}}.

Also, the entries in the table {{PROPERTYENTRY}} associated with that external entity are not deleted.

When the user is deleted, the entry in this table is not removed.

h5. SQL changes:
Currently, {{EXTERNAL_ENTITIES}} ID is no longer associate with {{Entry ID}}. You might need to modify your SQL query to use the association below without {{EXTERNAL_ENTITIES}} to get user properties:

*Tables:*
{code}
app_user
propertyentry
{code}

*Relationship:*
{code}
app_user.ID = propertyentry.entity_id
app_user.lower_user_name = cwd_user.lower_user_name
{code}
fields.summary: user entries in table EXTERNAL_ENTITIES do not get remove when the user is deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Slow render of ViewCustomFields page when there are many Custom fields available.

{panel:title=Original Summary}
We have ~ 1300 custom fields, and use Oracle. Since the introduction of the ManagedConfigurationItemService, the /secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa action takes ~ 45 seconds.

Most of this is due to the fact that {{com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.customfields.ViewCustomFields#isFieldLocked}} and isFieldManaged are called 4 times per custom field, each resulting in an OfBiz query.

Attaching a simple patch whereby a single query is made to find all locked fields. (The patch is just how I am working around this issue, not suggesting that you incorporate the patch per se).

[~jamieechlin]: The [^ViewCustomFields.java.patch] patch brings it down to around 10s, although it starts streaming in 3s.

+*Suggestion to fix the issue*+

Instead of calling the query multiple times, can we assess the possibility to call this SQL when loading the page?

{code}
SELECT ID, ITEM_ID, ITEM_TYPE, MANAGED, ACCESS_LEVEL, SOURCE, DESCRIPTION_KEY FROM public.managedconfigurationitem WHERE ITEM_TYPE='CUSTOM_FIELD'
{code}

{panel}

h3. Environment
Large Jira instance
* with many custom fields 1000+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 1000+ custom fields
# Open *Administrator > Custom fields* page ViewCustomFields.jspa

h3. Expected Results
Request takes <10 seconds to load

h3. Actual Results
Request takes 40+ seconds to load
 
h3. Notes
From SQL log, high number of SQLs executed to {{managedconfigurationitem}} table
{noformat}
zul-mbp:31july zul$ awk -F'(FROM|WHERE)' '/SELECT/{print $2}' viewCustomfield.txt | sort | uniq -c | sort -k1,1
   1  clusternode
   1  clusternodeheartbeat
   1  mailserver
   1  propertyentry
   1  propertynumber
  14  clusterlockstatus
  34  clusternode"
  60  clusteredjob
  60  nodeindexcounter
  60  replicatedindexoperation
  65  rundetails
 105  clustermessage
6980  managedconfigurationitem
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
_None_
fields.summary: rendering of custom fields in admin screen is very slow due to ManagedConfigurationItemService
Errors during bulk move should be displayed in the UI and not just the logs
Allow easier viewing of a user's history
security concern in secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=show
Support JIRA Mobile on BlackBerry Z10

fields.description:
Affected: Atlassian JIRA (v5.2.10#853)

Logged in as Administrator -> Select a project -> Versions -> Create new version -> Select date from datepicker:

Actual: The calendar week (22/Apr/2013-28/Apr/2013) is 16 (see screenshot).
 Expected: The calendar week (22/Apr/2013-28/Apr/2013) is 17

 

*Additional information:*

This issue is happening due to the fact that the second week of the year is skipped, as shown in the screenshot below:

!2ndWeekSkipped.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Incorrect calendar weeks display - German (second week of the calendar year is skipped)

fields.description: When uploading an image attachment JIRA occasionally fails to vertically scale image thumbnails, which breaks the page layout (see attachment). This only happens when the image is large compared to the amount of free memory in the JVM, and was caused by JRA-24633.
fields.summary: Image thumbnail height not scaled down

fields.description:
I change calendar javascript to Hijri, but it seems that a class (DueDateValidator.class) try to validate input date. My problem is that  the number of days in  specific month is different to Georgian calendar. for example we have 31 days in second month of year but in Georgian (February) it is 28 or 29.
Now is there any way to disable Date validator in jira?
fields.summary: Is it possible to change or disable Date validator in jira?

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There can be a significant number of the below errors in JIRA logs which is causing customers to raise issues and be more concerned about their instance that need be:

{noformat}
2013-04-17 23:15:19,474 Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem@6bce2c0c[issue=com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl@b185a44[id=312164,summary=why is iron man such a badass?,key=AVG-5269,created=2013-04-12 09:31:03.0,updated=2013-04-17 23:14:18.834,assignee=captain.planet:1,reporter=defaultavenger:1],remoteUser=admin:1,notificationType=All_Watchers,eventTypeId=6,templateId=6] INFO ServiceRunner    Mail Queue Service [renderer.wiki.links.JiraIssueLink] Unable to resolve an issue with key: AVG-5269
{noformat}

h3. Environment

* Google SMTP.
* PostgreSQL 9.1.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Admin comments on issue JRA-123 with body "Hey Fred I think you should take a look at JRA-55567!"
# When the e-mail tries render the wiki markup, it doesn't have a reference to any "current user", and permission checks in JiraIssueLink which is called during wiki rendering are done as Anonymous. Anonymous doesn't have permission to see JRA-55567 (lets say) which throws the ParseException which results in the error being logged
# Shouldn't cause any problems other than the issue not being linked but being plaintext in the e-mail body I think

Or

Add "UTF-8" to a comment, and it will try to render it as an issue link.

h3. Expected Results

No error is present in the logs.

h3. Actual Results

We see this error.

h3. Notes

This is thrown by {{JiraIssueLink.java}} due to a {{ParseException}}. Essentially this is a completely harmless error and can be ignored.
fields.summary: Improve the handling of the "Unable to resolve an issue with key: xxx-nnnn" error
